With today's funeral for Pope John Paul II, it's a good time to point the significance of his impact on the world.
 During his Papacy, Catholicism grew by 250,000,000 to 1.1 Billion.
 He was the first non-Italian Pope in 455 years.
 He was the first Polish Pope ever.
 He was the third youngest Pope in the Church's <2000 year history.
 He visited over 170 countries.
 He spoke 16 languages.
 7 Million mourners filed past his body and paid their respects.
 4 Million people watched the funeral throughout Rome, including over 80 heads of state including the presidents of Syria and Iran and the king of Jordan. 
 That's a true tribute to the man's life.
 Rest in Peace, John Paul Magnus.

On the question of John Paul's alleged pacifism, it's difficult to be sure. His attitude towards what catholics call the "just war" was ambiguous.
 
 For example; he declared himself against the military intervention in Iraq, but he supported peacekeeping operations in Haiti and Bosnia.
 
 In general, he persistently called for non-violent solutions in domestic and international conflicts.
